one-liner for bisect testing

#!/bin/sh
ant clean jar && \
./bin/cassandra >/dev/null && \
sleep 15 && \
./tools/bin/cassandra-stress write n=1000000 && \
echo flushing; ./bin/nodetool flush Keyspace1 && \
echo compacting; ./bin/nodetool compact Keyspace1 && \
find /var/lib/cassandra/data/ -name Keyspace1-Standard1-ka-*-Data.db && \
find /var/lib/cassandra/data/ -name Keyspace1-Standard1-ka-*-Data.db -exec ./bin/sstablesplit -v {} \; && \
find /var/lib/cassandra/data/ -name Keyspace1-Standard1-ka-*-Data.db
Assigning benedict since it seems to be his commit that broke things.

Looks like Keyspace.openWithoutSSTables is only ever called by Standalone tools, so the assertion doesn't make any sense there. Attached simple diff to remove it and add a comment explaining its intended use.

Going through my repo steps to verify, sstablesplit hangs with an exception and has to be interrupted. I do see the split tables 3,4,5 in the datadir.
